critical_context.sbir_status: NIH SBIR currently paused due to legislative authority expiring Oct 1, 2025. Expected to be reauthorized Q1-Q2 2026. Applications will likely reopen with April/May deadlines.
critical_context.nimh_digital_health: NIMH actively seeking digital mental health innovations through multiple mechanisms. High priority on pediatric/youth interventions.

nih_sbir_concepts.title: AI-Powered Bedtime Companion for Pediatric Mental Health Prevention
nih_sbir_concepts.tagline: Story Hour with Simon - Phase I SBIR
nih_sbir_concepts.description: Develop and validate an AI-powered bedtime intervention system that uses personalized storytelling and parent-child co-regulation to prevent anxiety and sleep disorders in children ages 3-8.

alignment.unique_value: First AI system designed specifically for preventive mental health during critical bedtime transition
alignment.competitive_advantage: Leverages parent-child dyad instead of isolating child with technology

phase_1_deliverables: AI personalization engine for story adaptation
Parent handoff system with co-regulation prompts
Biometric integration for real-time adaptation
Clinical validation protocol with 30 families
key_innovations: Natural language processing for child emotional state detection
Dynamic story arc adjustment based on arousal levels
Parent coaching delivered through narrative structure

commercialization.revenue_model: B2C subscription ($19.99/mo) + B2B2C health system licensing

nih_sbir_concepts.title: Family Crisis Detection & Intervention Platform
nih_sbir_concepts.tagline: Real-time family stress monitoring with just-in-time interventions
nih_sbir_concepts.description: Develop a multi-modal sensing platform that detects family stress patterns through ambient home devices and delivers evidence-based micro-interventions before crisis escalation.

alignment.unique_value: First system to monitor family-level (not individual) mental health dynamics
alignment.competitive_advantage: Privacy-first design using edge computing, no cloud surveillance

phase_1_deliverables: Multi-modal stress detection algorithm (voice, movement, interaction patterns)
Family dynamics modeling system
Intervention library with 50+ evidence-based micro-interventions
Privacy-preserving edge computing architecture
key_innovations: Federated learning for family pattern recognition
Contextual intervention matching based on family profile

commercialization.phase_2_path: Integration with child welfare systems for at-risk family support

nih_sbir_concepts.title: Adolescent Digital Phenotyping for Suicide Prevention
nih_sbir_concepts.tagline: Passive sensing + AI for early suicide risk detection in teens
nih_sbir_concepts.description: Create a privacy-preserving digital phenotyping system that uses smartphone passive sensing to detect early warning signs of suicidal ideation in adolescents, with automated clinical alerts.

alignment.unique_value: Only teen-specific suicide prevention system with passive detection
alignment.competitive_advantage: Co-designed with teens to ensure actual adoption and privacy

phase_1_deliverables: Passive sensing SDK for iOS/Android
Multimodal risk detection algorithm (85%+ sensitivity)
Clinical alert system with tiered responses
Teen privacy dashboard and consent framework
key_innovations: Differential privacy for teen data protection
Peer support activation for low-risk alerts

commercialization.phase_2_path: Integration with 988 crisis hotline + school counseling systems

nih_sbir_concepts.title: Cultural Bridge: Multilingual Family Therapy Assistant
nih_sbir_concepts.tagline: Breaking language barriers in family mental health care
nih_sbir_concepts.description: Develop an AI-powered translation and cultural adaptation system that enables effective family therapy across language and cultural barriers, specifically targeting immigrant and refugee families.

alignment.unique_value: First mental health tech explicitly designed for immigrant families
alignment.competitive_advantage: Cultural adaptation beyond translation - understanding family dynamics across cultures

phase_1_deliverables: Real-time therapy translation for 10 languages
Cultural context engine for therapeutic concepts
Therapist dashboard with cultural insights
Family engagement tools in native languages
key_innovations: Cultural metaphor mapping for therapeutic concepts

commercialization.phase_2_path: Medicaid billing codes for culturally adapted therapy

nih_sbir_concepts.title: School-Based Emotional Regulation Ecosystem
nih_sbir_concepts.tagline: Whole-school approach to preventive mental health
nih_sbir_concepts.description: Create a comprehensive digital platform that transforms schools into preventive mental health environments through teacher tools, student apps, and family engagement systems.

alignment.unique_value: Ecosystem approach vs. point solutions for school mental health
alignment.competitive_advantage: Integrates with existing school infrastructure and workflows

phase_1_deliverables: Teacher dashboard for classroom emotional climate
Student self-regulation app with gamification
Parent engagement portal with home activities
School-wide data analytics for early intervention
key_innovations: Classroom acoustic analysis for stress detection

commercialization.phase_2_path: State-level contracts + integration with IEP systems

nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.title: Therapeutic Entertainment Network for Families
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.tagline: Mindful Media's clinical content delivery platform
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.description: Build a comprehensive platform for delivering clinically-designed entertainment that strengthens family bonds while building emotional resilience, starting with underserved communities.

alignment.unique_value: Entertainment as trojan horse for mental health intervention
alignment.competitive_advantage: Only platform measuring mental health outcomes from media consumption

aims: Develop adaptive content recommendation based on family stress levels
Validate emotional regulation improvements through co-viewing
Test implementation in community health centers
methods: 3-arm RCT: Mindful Media vs. standard media vs. no media
Mixed methods with biomarkers + qualitative family interviews
Implementation science framework for community deployment

impact.scientific: First evidence for entertainment-based prevention at scale
impact.commercial: Creates evidence base for insurance reimbursement

nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.title: AI Therapist Training Simulator
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.tagline: VR-based training for culturally responsive therapy
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.description: Develop an AI-powered VR training system that helps therapists practice culturally responsive interventions with diverse virtual families, addressing the critical shortage of culturally competent providers.

alignment.unique_value: Safe space for therapists to make mistakes and learn
alignment.competitive_advantage: Infinite scenario generation based on real family dynamics

aims: Create AI system for generating culturally authentic family scenarios
Validate training effectiveness through therapist performance metrics
Assess impact on therapy outcomes with real families
methods: Therapist training RCT: AI simulator vs. traditional training

impact.scientific: New paradigm for clinical training evaluation
impact.clinical: Addresses therapist shortage in underserved communities
impact.commercial: Licensing to therapy training programs nationwide

nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.title: Community Trauma Response Network
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.tagline: Rapid deployment mental health support for community crises
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.description: Create a digital platform that enables rapid community-based mental health response to collective trauma events (shootings, natural disasters, etc.) through coordinated peer and professional support.

alignment.competitive_advantage: Leverages existing social networks for rapid deployment

aims: Design community activation protocols for crisis response
Develop matching algorithms for peer support
Create outcome measurement framework for community interventions
methods: Mixed methods evaluation of response effectiveness

impact.scientific: New model for community mental health mobilization
impact.policy: Model for federal crisis response funding

nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.title: Infant Mental Health Prediction System
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.tagline: AI-powered early detection of developmental concerns
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.description: Develop a home-based monitoring system that uses computer vision and acoustic analysis to detect early signs of autism, anxiety, and attachment disorders in infants, enabling intervention before symptoms fully manifest.

alignment.unique_value: Earliest possible mental health intervention - infancy
alignment.competitive_advantage: Non-invasive, continuous monitoring in natural environment

aims: Validate predictions against clinical assessments at 18-36 months
methods: Monthly assessments from birth to 36 months
Machine learning model development and validation

nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.title: Digital Therapeutic Formulary
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.tagline: Evidence-based matching of digital interventions to patient needs
nimh_digital_mental_health_concepts.description: Create a clinical decision support system that matches patients to appropriate digital mental health interventions based on symptom profiles, cultural factors, and treatment history.

alignment.unique_value: Solves the 'app overwhelm' problem in digital mental health
alignment.competitive_advantage: Independent evaluation of all available digital therapeutics

aims: R21: Develop matching algorithm and evaluate existing digital therapeutics
R33: Clinical trial of formulary vs. usual care
methods: Systematic review and meta-analysis of digital interventions
Algorithm development using collaborative filtering + clinical rules
Pragmatic trial in real-world clinical settings

impact.scientific: First comprehensive evaluation framework for digital therapeutics
impact.clinical: Improves outcomes through better intervention matching
impact.policy: Model for FDA regulation of digital therapeutics
